alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Montgomery; Pulaski (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 11:59PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Pulaski, southwestern Floyd, east central Wythe, northeastern Carroll and southwestern Montgomery Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1158 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Draper, or over Pulaski, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Radford... Pulaski... Dublin... Indian Valley... Willis... Allisonia... and Patterson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for southwestern Virginia...and southeastern West Virginia.
